reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: I’ve used Treatlife switches for years. But these switches in four pack have a very different interface in the smartlife app. It’s is very confusing…for example “on” and “off” are replaced by “ switch open” or “switch close” …. What ????? They have different modes when you try to set a schedule have no idea how this works. They need to go back to old software interface. This is awful
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2025
reviews.title: They changed app interface it’s terrible

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: The switches are a great value for the money. they were easy to install and look very nice. The software could use some improvement although after a little trial and error I was able to connect everything to the network and Alexa recognized the switches immediately. I would suggest to the company that the glow light on the switch should be on when they are off not when they are on. At night it would be nice to see the switches. Other than that I like them.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2025
reviews.title: Great value for a smart switch

reviews.text: Great for the first 3 years then complete failure. I installed this all over my house exactly 3 years ago. Today, within 1 hour, three of the switches went completely dead. No storms or power spikes. Even a physical press does not help. I tested with a voltameter. I happened to have a replacement switch available and it immediately worked instead.

reviews.text: We love these switches! They work well with the OEM app and they work with Samsung smarthings, Google home, and more. They are easy to install and easy to add to the OEM app. The size can be a bit large and difficult to fit if you are installing them into a multi gag electrical box, and the require a ground a neutral connection, but if you know what you are doing, you can fit them in no problem and you will love them!

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: These are great initially, but our switches have been failing a little over 2 years after the first install. 4 switches have died within weeks of each other. We mistakenly bought another set to replace the first failure — it kept disconnecting and needed to be reset until it no longer responded. After we replaced that, 3 others followed and we’ve noticed another start with the same issues. We have Leviton switches in other rooms that have lasted longer without any failure or connectivity issues. Unfortunately, we will probably be stuck with continually replacing these as we are not confident the rest will last.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2024
reviews.title: Consistent failure after a few years

reviews.text: New home, installed a total of 18 switches (1-pole, 3-way, dimmers, 3w dimmers). Built in 2020. Loved them at first. Started losing some within 1st year. Now 10/18 are either dead or offline. Most still function as a dumb switch. Not entirely sure of the reason… we do lose power fairly often. Some of the failures occurred upon a power loss so maybe they are sensitive to line spikes/noise. Anyway, I’m now replacing them all and will try a different brand.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: I recently embarked on a large home renovation project and decided to install smart switches for all my lights, ordering 20 TreatLife switches, along with multiple 2-gang and 3-gang wall plates. Unfortunately, this decision turned into the biggest headache of the project. During installation, my electricians discovered that the TreatLife smart 3-way switches didn’t work with the other TreatLife 3-way switches and would need to be paired with non-smart switches. The lights would randomly go to the dimmest setting. Worse, I had no choice in which side the smart switch went on due to existing wiring, leading to awkward placements where smart switches were alone, and non-smart switches were grouped with others—resulting in a messy, unattractive look (see images). I contacted TreatLife, and while each response took a day or more, they finally confirmed that their 3-way smart switches only work with 3-way non-smart switches, WHICH THEY DON’T EVEN MAKE! Not very smart for a ‘smart’ switch company. They offered no solution for the mismatched look, and to top it off, refused to accept returns on the unopened switches that would not work with their other switches as it had been over 30 days. I ultimately found a solution with Lutron Caseta switches, which allow two matching switches on either side of the 3-way configuration through an innovative remote that can be installed to look just like the hard-wired switch while allowing way more flexibility with installation locations since no wiring is needed for the remote side. The result? A seamless, functional setup I love. While it required an additional investment and another electrician visit, the new system is worth every penny. If you want matching switches for your 3-way lights, STAY AWAY FROM TREATLIFE!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024
reviews.title: If you want matching switches for your 3-way lights, STAY AWAY FROM TREATLIFE!

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: One of my old electrical box was so tight that I couldn't get the switch all the way in. I had to disconnect all the wires and shave the box a bit to get it in all the way. I can't be the only person with this problem, so maybe the switch should be just a little shorter in height. After 6 months one of the switches failed.

reviews.text: These were great while they lasted. I bought a dozen for my home. Right around the three year mark they all began to fail one by one. The physical switches start to lose their sensitivity and responsiveness. At this point each switch requires numerous presses in various locations in order for the switch to respond on or off. The company does not stand by their product outside of the warranty period. Here is their email response to my case after providing them with video evidence: “For your case, the switch should be broken. Treatlife stand by 24-month warranty. Your order was placed on April, 2021, which has passed our warranty period. Or if you still have other order?”

reviews.title: Buyer beware: Systematic failure after 3 years

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: I’ve had these switches in 2 of my homes over the last couple of years. Sometimes over time and sometimes right away, eventually your lights will start to flicker because of the quality of the switch. Eventually or right away it allows a tiny bit of power to flow through the switches causing the lights to flicker or sometimes you’ll turn the switch on in one room and lights in another room will come on. I know that it is the switch causing the problem because I am a journeymen electrician and after replacing the switches to regular dimmers they stopped flickering. I like the switches, they work well with Alexa but I wish the quality was a lot better.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
reviews.title: Lights will flicker eventually

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: I bought a lot of these switches back in June of 21. At first they worked great. Weren’t the easiest to get working with Alexa but overall functioned. Since then I’ve had to replace many of them. They either lose network connection for no reason or just flat out stop. Like won’t even work by manually pushing the switch. If your house has frequent power hits, forget these completely. They will fry. Where as brands like Kasa and Lutron in my house still work perfectly fine. if you have a lot of them they will take up a crazy amount of your bandwidth on WiFi. The thickness of the switches is an issue in smaller switch boxes. A couple of my boxes where there were numerous wires these switches had to be practically forced into, which caused a couple to not work. Yet again used another brand to fit in those boxes. Just the other day went to replace one that had randomly quit working and the new one won’t program out of the box new. With all that said I won’t ever re buy this brand and will replace with other brands as they fail
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2024
reviews.title: In the Long term not worth it

reviews.text: I bought multiple switches from Treatlife, and installed them throughout the house. The switches just work out of the box. They had a very easy setup via mobile app for connecting the smart switch to wifi, and even integrating them with Alexa. After about a month's use, one of the switches blew up, and I wrote an email to support team. The team was pleasant to work with. They acknowledged and understood my issue and immediately sent me a replacement switch. The new switch worked like a charm. Very happy with the company and their product line. I highly recommend them.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: These work okay once they're installed, but configuring them can be a problem. It took me more than an hour to get it working, and I don't know why it finally started working. The next day, the connected light was flashing and the switch was unresponsive. It won't reset. I couldn't find any support for this problem. I can only conclude that the switch failed in the first 24 hours of service. I don't know why it failed. It's all rather disappointing.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.title: Difficult to install, Couldn't find support

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: I spent $850 over the course of a year changing all my switches to Treatlife products to manager dozens of recessed can lights, bathroom fans, ceiling fans, etc. With so many switches and kids, I thought it would be great to be able to dim the massive amount of can lights and also control them to keep lights all over the house from being left on. The theory is great but the switches are not. I have fought several to keep them on the network constantly resetting them. Several have been replaced. Several are not working now and I had to put the old toggle switches back into one fixture. I have a mesh network so signal is never a problem. Every time we have a power outage of any sort, many get messed up and have to be reconnected to the network / app. The newest versions I bought as replacements are even harder to get online since they “automated” the process. I have 2 that cannot be synced and are brand new. 3 out of the 4 fan light combination switches have failed. Naturally some that I have the most trouble with are in the basement and I have to go down to turn off one switch out of 3 that my kids left on even after using the app to turn off ALL basement lights. I contacted Treatlife about some of these issues and they wanted me to go thru all the programming steps and tell them what happens at each step. I explained it is not even turning on so I cannot make it do anything. Then they said I must have made a mistake wiring them. I am an engineer and have wired several houses and barns including fixing others mistakes. This is all run around to avoid warranty claims. They won’t stand behind the high failure rate products. My advice is to limit your installations to only devices that benefit from connectivity and avoid the headache and expense of such a buggy system. Definitely not worth the hype for a whole home install. And definitely not worth a wife being upset the lights or ceiling fan is not working.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.title: Not worth the headache

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: Have had Wemo light switches for about 3 years. They worked just OK. Frequently dropped off line. Every time that the wireless mesh network (eero) updated I had to go and relink all of them. Finally with the latest update, they just refused to link at all. I have been using the Wemo Alexa skill and it is weak at best. I replaced four of them in the garage with these units in about an hour. They set up very easily and QUICKLY. And they work GREAT with Alexa. I ordered four more. No more Wemo. What a pain to maintain them.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.title: Wonderful switch

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: The only good thing about these switches is that they are very easy to install and they look so much better. But their technology is so bad. None of my switches would connect to wifi. I tried EZ installation with a 2.4 GHZ network. All of my other smart plugs, and smart light bulbs would connect so easily not these switches. I spent 3 days trying to connect the switches to the app. I tried both apps SmartLife and TreatLife. It does not make any difference. I tried AP installation, but the Wifi hotspot that it creates would not even stay on for more than 30 seconds and the app spins for 2 mins and then it shows a generic message. I made a big mistake buying these. I would not recommend buying it to anyone. Please stay away from this product.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviews.title: WORST SWITCHES EVER - DO NOT BUY

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: After 3 years, I found manual switch no longer works. This happens to all my 3 switches.I read many have the same problem. I found a way to make it work again. I open the Smart Life app, select the switch, go to edit, select “Remove Device”. Select delete and wipe all data. The switch will start blinking, next use the app and add and set up the switch. After that the manual switch works again. Worked for all 3 switches, just not sure how long this fix will work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.title: Manual switch no longer working - how to fix

reviews.text: While it works it is great. So far we've had two switches that would begin switching on on their own after about 3 years of normal use. Then they will not turn off even if you press them manually. Only a matter of time before the rest of our switches start doing the same thing.

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: Got this switch 2 pack ( 4 each) on Aug 2022. Couple of switches stopped connecting to the Wifi and started operating like a normal switch. Tried reseting the switch. But, no use still behaves the same. Even restarted the breaker switch NO USE. replaced with the new switch works as expected. The Faulty switch behaves the same. the other switches works as expected. Only 2 switch have this behavior and wating for the customer support to have. them replaced.

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: These smart switches are working well. I order the 4 pack because we are replacing a few current smart switches with these. Nothing really wrong with the existing switches except for the indicator led (Red for on and Green for off) are failing on random switches. The new ones look good and have a white lit circle when they are turned off. Looks clean and neat. Will buy another 4 pack when these are installed.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2023
reviews.title: Second time to order

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE Smart Switch 4 Pack, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Single-Pole, Neutral Wire Required, Works with Alexa, Google Home and SmartThings, Smart Home Remote Control, FCC Listed
reviews.text: I have about 20 different TreatLife smart switches in my home -- on/off, dimmer, combo fan/light, remote, etc. I have had great success with them and they just work as expected. They all work with the SmartLife app which keeps everything in one app for ease of access. I had a couple of devices fail early after installation but TreatLife was very quick to replace the defective devices. Great products and great customer service -- I will stick with TreatLife for all of my smart home switches and accessories!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2023
reviews.title: I LOVE TreatLife smart devices
